name: Tutorial
body:
### Getting Started

After installing RIGHT package successfully, you can draw your own interactive graphs very easily.

Since RIGHT syntax is based on R-basic graphic, even beginners can use RIGHT package with ease. You just need to wrap R-basic syntax with RIGHT bracket.

For example, in original R, you can draw basic scatter grpahs like below.

```R
> plot(price ~ carat, diamonds, type="p")
```

And it will show like below graph.
![](http://thepotter.woobi.co.kr/img/scatter_R.PNG)
![](http://thepotter.woobi.co.kr/img/scatter_R.PNG)
 
Now, what you need to get our RIGHT graph is just wrapping with RIGHT bracket.
```R
> RIGHT(plot(price ~ carat, diamonds, type="p"))
```
Finally you can get the exactly same graph, but beautiful and interactive one, on your default browser!

![](http://thepotter.woobi.co.kr/img/scatter_diamonds.PNG)
